name: FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity

– using the correct and complete set of drawings
– all drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
1.2 Implementation of all measures and controls

REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure sign size and image correspond with contract drawings Road Signage Installation
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Check for any services in proximity to points of installation of posts (Road Sign Preparation)
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Ground penetration permit, This ITP signed off
2.1 Set out of line markings; dimensions and spacings
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing line marking works

○ Painting/application of material shall not commence until the Superintendent has inspected the set out and given consent to proceed, unless an exemption has been granted in writing by the Superintendent.
(a) New pavement markings shall be positioned in accordance with the following requirements:
(i) set out by the Contractor in conformance with the appropriate standard required by Clause 721.A03
(ii) applied within the tolerances listed in Table 721.A101.

(b) Temporary Reflective Markers Temporary reflective markers for new works shall be placed at the following minimum spacings on all longitudinal lane lines, except that on any curve less than 500 m in radius the spacing shall not be more than 12 metre centres:
○ AADT ≥5,000 and National Highway 12 metre centres
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document review & Site inspection
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Consent to proceed by Superintendent OR written exemption granted, This ITP signed
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing line marking works
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Line marking material is to comply with minimum requirements as specified in Spec Tables 721.D021 and 721.E021
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Material compliance, This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Markers shall comply with the relevant requirements of AS 1906, Part 3.
○ Epoxy adhesive shall be Standard Set or Rapid Set adhesive complying with the relevant requirements of AS 3554
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Adhesive components shall be batched so that the mixed adhesive contains not less than 45% nor more than 55% by volume of either component. Before starting work each day, or when changing to a different batch of adhesive, a hand mixed colour standard shall be prepared for reference during the day.
○ When hand-mixing is used not more than 500 g of each component shall be mixed at any time.
○ The components shall be mixed on a flat surface and the mixed adhesive shall be used within 10 minutes of the time the two components are brought together.
○ Hot melt bitumen adhesive shall not be used on days of total fire ban without the written approval of the Tasmanian Fire Service
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Contractor shall sweep or air blast each marker site as necessary to remove loose material before placing markers. Markers shall only be placed at locations where the pavement is free from dirt, oil, grease, paint, or any other material
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Markers shall not be placed in any of the following circumstances:
• when the relative humidity is greater than 80%;
• when the ambient temperature or the temperature of the road surface is less than 15deg for standard set adhesive or 0deg for rapid set or hot melt adhesive.

○ Where a marker is not positioned correctly within 10 seconds for hot melt bitumen adhesive, 2 minutes for rapid set machine mix adhesive, 4 minutes for standard set machine mix, or 10 minutes for standard set hand mix from the time mixing commences, it shall be discarded and a new marker placed.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (a) Markers in Line with Broken Line Segments
○ Transverse position within 25 mm of the centreline of the segments.
○ Longitudinal position within 0.5 m of the specified position.
○ Transverse position of the centre of each marker within 25 mm of the specified position and within 10 mm of a line joining the centres of the end markers of the group.
○ Clearance to edge of line within 5 mm of that specified.
○ Longitudinal mismatch between markers in transverse pairs at barrier line not more than 25 mm.
○ Lower edge of the reflective face at 85deg to 95deg to the centreline of the roadway or any adjacent line.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Line marking shall comply with the tolerances shown in Table 721.A101.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Table 721.A131, Project Spec. Table 721.A101
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document review & Site inspection
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
○ Where the removal of unsuitable pavement marking is required, the method of removal shall be subject to the approval of the Superintendent before removal works commence
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Approval from Superintendent, This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Set out work in accordance with drawings and in accordance with alignments, levels, grades, and sections.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
FREQUENCY: Four weeks prior to installation

○ If the Contractor proposes to use an alternative method of installation, the Contractor shall submit full details to the Superintendent for approval not later than four weeks before the commencement of sign installation
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
○ The required positions of all posts and signs shall be as directed by the Superintendent who shall confirm the positions before the erection of posts commences.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Sign to be installed as per most current project and DSG standard drawings, local council documentation, and to the correct height and position.
○ Signs specified to be re used are to comply with AS 1742 standards, and must be replaced if deemed in unsatisfactory condition
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: DSG standard drawings. Cl 714.07
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Posts vertical with maximum deviation of 1 in 100
○ Post tops 50mm +-10mm below top edge of sign
○ Signs mounted level with maximum deviation of 1 in 100
○ +-40mm of the height specified in the Sign and Post schedule
○ +-100mm of the pegged sign location or specified location
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off

(1) Apparent line of the markings is a smooth, continuous alignment when viewed in the direction of the line.
(2) Maintenance of pavement markings: If the gap between the existing lines is 90 mm or less the gap shall not be reduced by the maintenance application.
Testing Period (1) || Initial Measurement: 3 - 5 weeks || Additional Measurement: 5 - 6 months
Minimum level of retroreflectivity on sprayed seal surfaces || Initial Measurement: 350 mcd/lux/m^2 || Additional Measurement: 220 mcd/lux/m^2
Minimum level of retroreflectivity on asphalt and all other surfaces || Initial Measurement: 350 mcd/lux/m^2 || Additional Measurement: 250 mcd/lux/m^2
(1) Measured after application of the second/final coat of material.
Table 721.D021 Minimum Requirements - Paint and Glass Beads
0.38 mm dft on sprayed seals || Type D-HR (3)
0.35 mm dft on asphalt and all other surfaces || Type D-HR (3)
• Re-marking (including second application on new markings
0.38 mm dft on sprayed seals || Type D-HR (3)
0.35 mm dft on asphalt and all other surfaces || Type D-HR (3)
0.35 mm dft on sprayed seals || Type B-HR
0.30 mm dft on asphalt and all other surfaces || Type B-HR

(1) The minimum dry paint film thickness (dft) specified above shall be the end product thickness measured on a 200 mm x 100 mm sheet metal test plate without beads. Consideration shall be given to the texture of the road surface and the method of application used to achieve the requirements of this section.
(2) A minimum of 400 g/m^2 shall be retained in the painted marking for all glass beads.

(3) An alternative glass bead application rate shall be 300 g/m^2 of D-HR with a separate drop of 200 g/m^2 of B-HR provided that 75% minimum of the D-HR beads is retained at the 5 demonstrated by photographs at each test site.
Table 721.E021 Minimum Requirements - Long Life and Glass Beads
Material || Applied Minimum Thickness, Glass Bead and Other Requirements

Sprayed markings || 2.0 mm minimum thickness on logitudinal lines contaiing internmix beads and with a minimum of 400 g/m^2 of Type D-HR or Type B-HR(3) drop-on glass beads retained on the marking surface

Extruded line markings (1) || 2.0 mm minimum thickness on longitudinal lines containing internmix beads and a minimum of 400 g/m^2 of the Type D-HR or Type B-HR drop-on glass beads retained on the marking surface

Extruded road markings (1) || 3.0 mm minimum thickness on intersections containing internmix beads and a minimum of 400 g/m^2 of Type D-HR or Type B-HR drop-on glass beads retained on the marking surface
Preformed markings || 2.3 mm with a minimum skidding resistance value of 45 BPN (British Pendulum Number) and retroreflective properties agreed with the Superintendent
Profiled lines (1) || 8.0 mm minimum thickness with a minimum of 400 g/m^2 of Type D-HR or Type B-HR drop-on glass beads retained on the marking surface
Sprayed line markings (2) || 1.0 mm minimum thickness for longitudinal line markings only with a minimum of 400 g/m^2 of Type D-HR or Type B-HR glass beads retained in and on the marking surface

Sprayed road markings (2) || 2.0 mm minimum thickness for all road markings containing intermix beads and a minimum of 400 g/m^2 of Type D-HR or Type B-HR drop-on glass beads retained on the marking surface

Trowelled, screeded, or extruded markings (1) || 2.0 mm minimum thickness of markings containing intermix beads and a minimum of 400 g/m^2 of Type D-HR or Type B-HR drop-on glass beads retained on the marking surface
(1) The minimum thickness specified shall be the height above the upper road surface level or above the existing marking as appropriate.

(2) The minimum thickness specified shall be the height of the material between the glass beads on a metal test plate. All other thicknesses shall be as measured on a metal test plate including glass beads.
(3) Pristine drop-on Type B glass beads (Type B-HR), as per Clause 721.A05.
